name: GetPortfolioMemberships
description:
Retrieve portfolio memberships from Asana.

Retrieve a list of portfolio memberships based on specified criteria such as portfolio, user, or workspace from Asana. Useful for managing and accessing user roles in project management.

parameters.name: portfolio_filter
parameters.description: Specify the portfolio ID to filter the results.

value_schema.description: The portfolio to filter results on.

parameters.name: workspace_filter
parameters.description: Specify the workspace to filter portfolio membership results. This should match the workspace identifier used in Asana.

value_schema.description: The workspace to filter results on.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: A string identifier for a user: "me", an email, or the user's gid.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of portfolio memberships to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Token for pagination to retrieve the next page of results. Use the offset provided by a previous response.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: A list of optional properties to include in the response. Provide them as an array of strings.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty output formatting with indentation for readability. Ideal for debugging, it increases response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.description: The portfolio to filter results on.

value_schema.description: The portfolio to filter results on.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The workspace to filter results on.

value_schema.description: The workspace to filter results on.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*
